text: Oh nice <@U8D9768Q6>. Any resources on your workflow / setup?

elements.text: . Any resources on your workflow / setup?

text:
In case another config is helpful: <https://github.com/dangirsh/.doom.d#jupyter|https://github.com/dangirsh/.doom.d#jupyter>

I often use this org notebook to set up an env + context, then "associate" a Julia source code buffer to the kernel. That allows me to directly evaluate code in packages. For code inside functions, I use the jupyter REPL / org blocks to set test values for the function arguments, then evaluate within the function as I like.

This is the main way I write Julia. I really only use the standard REPL for running tests.
